knimeNode.name: Amazon Redshift Connector
knimeNode.shortDescription: Create a database connection to Amazon Redshift.

intro.p: This node creates a connection to Amazon Redshift using the native Amazon Redshift JDBC driver. You need to provide the server's hostname (or IP address), the port, and a database name. Login credentials can either be provided directly in the configuration or via credentials set on the workflow.
For more information visit Amazon Redshift and also the AWS Forums.

This node uses the selected driver's URL template for creating the concrete database URL. For additional drivers, which are not provided by the KNIME database modules, the URL template is to be specified on the driver preferences page under KNIME/Databases. E.g.

ul.li:
Mandatory value (e.g. <database>):
The referenced variable must have a non-blank value. The name between the brackets must be a valid variable name. Please refer to the variable descriptions below.

Optional value (e.g. [database]):
The referenced variable may have a blank value. The name between the brackets must be a valid variable name. Please refer to the variable descriptions below.

host:
The value of the Hostname field on the Connection Settings tab.

port:
The value of the Port field on the Connection Settings tab.

database:
The value of the Database name field on the Connection Settings tab.

intro.p: Field validation in the dialog depends on whether the (included) tokens referencing them are mandatory or optional.

tab.name: Connection settings
tab.option: Choose the registered database dialect here.
Choose the registered database driver here. Additional drivers can be registered via KNIME's preference page "KNIME -> Databases".
The hostname (or IP address) of an Amazon Redshift server. The corresponding driver URL template variable is host.
The port on which the Amazon Redshift server is listening. The default port is 5,439. The corresponding driver URL template variable is port.
The name of the database you want to connect to. The corresponding driver URL template variable is database.
If checked, the credentials (user and password) are used as defined on the workflow. The credential name links to the specified user and password.
Your log-in user name and password for the database. Note that the password is encrypted before storage and decrypted afterwards for being used internally.

tab.name: JDBC Parameters
tab.description: This tab allows you define JDBC driver connection parameter. The value of a parameter can be a constant, variable, credential user, credential password or KNIME URL. For more information about the supported driver properties see the Redshift documentation.

tab.name: Advanced
tab.description: This tab allows you to define KNIME framework properties such as connection handling, advanced SQL dialect settings or logging options.

tab.name: Input Type Mapping
tab.description: This tab allows you to define rules to map from database types to KNIME types.
tab.option: Columns that match the given name (or regular expression) and database type will be mapped to the specified KNIME type.
Columns that match the given database type will be mapped to the specified KNIME type.

tab.name: Output Type Mapping
tab.description: This tab allows you to define rules to map from KNIME types to database types.
tab.option: Columns that match the given name (or regular expression) and KNIME type will be mapped to the specified database type.
Columns that match the given KNIME type will be mapped to the specified database type.
